text: Pours in black body wit h low tan head. Aroma has a lot of caramel, light wine character, fruity hops. Peach, dark fruits. Taste has high bitterness upfront, some woody notes in the after taste. Light wine character. Body is full, medium carbonation.

Bottle. Brown with ruby tones with white off head. Chocolate, port wine aroma. Full body, low carbonation. Long bitter finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0,75l bottle shared by mmahut at Bratislava RB Tasting, big big thanks for this one. black color, small coffee-colored head. smells yeasty, grassy, light currant, a bit underwhelming smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes currant notes, some sweetness, light roasty, caramel, some grapes, very lightly bitterness form the hops. finishes with some caramel and currant notes. decent stuff, but a bit underwhelming. no hops left which is OK with the barrelaging, but unfortunatly no real roast notes to speak of, rather sweetish thing. I was hoping for more, but maybe not in the prime.

750 ml bottle shared by Mmahut at Bratislava Tasting, many thanks!
Dark brown body, with a moderate, creamy, beige head.
Aoma of smooth roast, grapefruit, moderate barrel notes.
Tastes of roast, dark chocolate, grapefruit, orange, some pine, barrel notes, some alcohol burn.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes roasty, medium bitter, a bit alcohol warming, a bit zesty, a bit fruity.

Nice one, but I was expecting a bit more. Pretty smooth and well balanced, but not really complex. Nice sipper after all.

Bottle. Clear dark liquid. Aroma contains both malts and hopiness. Roasty and caramel notes. Some dark fruits. Taste is quite the same. Dry in the end. Good one. Wine is not very significant both in aroma and taste, but i think, that it appears.

Bottle at tasting, Gurthnars place. Dark brown color with medium beige head. Strong bitter aroma with dark malt. Roasted malt, coffee, citrus hops in taste. Long citrus hoppy finish with coffee notes. Tasty.

Bottle at Joined Slovak&Austian ratebeer session 10/2015. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, oak wood, licorice. Taste is sweet, medium bitter, chocolate, coffee, hoppy, licorice, wood, bit citrusy - orange.

Clear dark brown body with coffee cream coloured head. Aroma is hoppy, with some citrus notes, caramel. Has a light carbonation, a light creamy feel in the mouth. Light sweetness of caramel followed by light hoppy bitterness with some earthy and woody notes.

Bottle at a tasting. Really rich, flavourful. High bitterness, also lots of citrusy hoppy flavour. The barrel ageing left only a pleasant complementary note. Really good condition, really moreish and tasty. Smooth, soft yet intense.

4/IX/15 - 75cl swing top bottle from a trade @ home - BB: 26/VIII/15 (oops!) (2015-1159) Thanks to mmahut for the trade!
Clear dark brown beer, huge creamy beige head, very stable, adhesive, leaving some nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: lot of citrus, fruity, caramel, bit sweet, malty. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: lots of citrus, very hoppy, very fruity, pineapple, nice bitterness, some caramel, mocha. Aftertaste: grassy, bitter, citrus, little sweet, caramel, exotic fruits, hoppy. Wow, this is good stuff!!

Bottle 0,75l. Cloudy, dark brown colored. AROMA- a bit sweet, citrusy, licorice, bubble gum, red wine, slightly chocolate and caramel, dark malt. FLAVOR- very smooth, sweet, medium bitterness, citrusy, licorice, dark chocolate, red wine, barrel. Bittersweet aftertaste.  A full range of flavours, perfect for slow savouring. Great!

Bottle 0,75l. Very dark brown body with ruby reflections, medium beige head. Beautiful aroma of citruses, licorice, dark fruits, toasted malts. Taste is bitter and sweet with dry finish and light sweetish aftertaste. Plenty of citruses, dark malts, licorice, red berries and notes of red wine. Nice harmony and complexity. Very smooth on tongue. Silky fuller body, medium carbonation.Yes, this is a class (or more) above classic Černá raketa. Just delicious.
